title: La guarida del sushi
abstract: POS software for efficient restaurant management experience
process: POS software often tend to have many options on the screen and sometimes the users felt overwhelmed and frustrated. In the previous version of the software, we had the same issues. Although this software was to be designed from scratch, we took it as an opportunity to learn what went wrong and solve certain issues.

I started with gathering information from the existing app and evaluated the pain-points of the existing software users. We did not conduct any formal user interviews due to lack of time & resources but asked the current users about their experience and what they think would be helpful to add/update in the software. I researched about a typical POS software, did some competitive analysis and created a mood board for necessary features to cover in the software.
The screen was divided into 4 main sections: navbar, table section, items section, main-billing section. Here are some initial lo-fi wireframes.

To maintain consistency and ensure efficient design to dev handover, I developed a modular design system based on reusable components and their states, such as cards, list items, and controls. I have covered a few here:

After trying some fonts, colors & icons, I started building hi-fi wireframes. I started with the 'Items page' where we can add/edit item-category & items, then continued with the 'Tables page' & 'Billing page'.
It was a fun project to work on. There were almost no constraints. The communication went very smooth, from initial discovery to branding and through the final revisions and delivery.

title: Robix UML
abstract: Robix UML is a diagramming web application to facilitate the adoption of the robustness analysis for software requirements specification.
process: As a result of prioritizing working software over comprehensive documentation, a common problem in agile software development teams is the lack of documentation, resulting in rapid developement projects but unsustainable maintenance. Focusing on requirements specification, Scrumconix is a hybrid methodology that proposes to use the robustness analysis as the main artifact for requirements specification, since it allows sufficient documentation without losing the agile approach. However, due to its low presence in popular methodologies, the use of this type of diagram is not very widespread. The challenge was to design a tool that facilitates the adoption of this diagram as part of a study with the aim of reducing the lack of documentation in software teams.

During this phase we scheduled meetings with the client to agree on the app features based on its needs. Moreover, since the diagram and the methodology it comes from where unfamiliar to the team, it was necessary to do research on it.

Being the main funcionality to create a diagram, we focus the UI on the canvas. Keeping this in mind, this component occupies the entire screen, thus the user can visualize a greater number of elements of the diagram.

Robix UML is a web based application that works entierly client side, it was build using React and is made out of two parts: A view layer, consisting of the UI elements that the user interacts with, and a business logic layer, which defines the behaviour of the diagram elements.

The application had a positive reception from users and meets the expected goals. Regarding the construction, the biggest challenge was the functionality of joining elements, since drawing the connectors required designing different trigonometric models that would allow calculating the optimal positions of both the lines and their text, allowing the best use of space and avoiding overlapping elements.
